page.title: 03Farming on Lansallos coast
page.content: The farming is carried out mostly by tenants of the National Trust. It is mainly sheep and cattle rearing, with some greens and cauliflowers and cereal crops.Potatoes are also grown and are of good quality and early season and thus very profitable. Potatoes are also grown in allottments on the cliffs-usually sold in local shops.The fishing is mostly 'inshore' by handline for special fish like turbot and other expensive varieties. Crab and lobster are also caught mainly for domestic consumption or use by restaraunts in nearby Polperro.
